I want to thank Jhope for making this song and JITB in general. ARMYs will remember very well how we felt after hearing that BTS would leave us 2-3 years, but without letting us to be sad, he released this and ARMY was like "if this is what solo period is, I-say-more causa I WANT SOME MORE!!" :) He made it just easier for us, we didn't felt alone at all, and since then we never lost our precious bound with our idols who were on hiatus + military. So let's continue supporting him, now even more, because after only 2 months he'll be back! APOBANPO  <3

1- Make sure you are watching at least 480. Sometimes when we return to the video the resolution drops.   2- Always leave a like or comment on the videos, not just this one. Even if they use a playlist, they occasionally interact with it. For YouTube, don't think it's robot behavior.    3-  Watch at least 3 or 4 videos between one stream and another.   4- They should not always use the same videos and sometimes change the order in which they watch them.    5- It is also advisable that they are not all by the same artist. And even from the same agency. For example, we can use the boys  feats or listen to an artist/song that we really like.   6- Do not write several comments in a row. YouTube may think it's spam and remove the views.    7- Emojis do not remove views. So stop annoying people and end up spamming them.   8- Don't stop the video. Don't go backwards or forwards. Watch at normal speed.   9- See the ads.  At least one of them, don't always ignore it.  10- The volume must be at least 50%, but we can use headphones.   11- Also, we should use performance videos or even watch videos that are not related to K-pop or even music,  in random videos.  12- Don't be on two sides at the same time (mobile phone/television) with the same YouTube account open.

On this very special day for you, I would like to wish you: lots of health, happiness, more fans, true love and that all your deepest dreams will come true. I first listened to and enjoyed this song and my perspective of j-hope was like ok, he's a little dark, serious, strong... And then I discovered j-jope in BTS and I was like... ok, who dis? he's so sunny n funny haha  What got me into this song was a reel that translated some lyrics and "a fireman of chaos" & I was struck by him singing that "it's done, my dream, done, success, done, my part of the job" were some really powerful lyrics. He already achieved everything I dream of at my age, and now he's like.. should I burn it all and go on with my life or burn even brighter and invest my energy even more to create more fire stuff? I hope we'll get more of him. Truly inspiring!

Paradoxically, it is now easier to become famous at the expense of hatred than at the expense of love. hatred is easier to get into people's souls. this is a sign of a weak society.

IPORTANT!!! PLEASE READ!!!  â€¼â€¼BTS IS A GLOBAL PHENOMENON. ARMY is an amazing fandom. The story of BTS and ARMY is an incredible story of trust, respect and support. You can study this topic to understand how much the haters and enemies of BTSARMY are trying to cast the fandom in a negative light. People who don't know fall for this lie so gullibly without realizing what's going on.  â€¼â€¼Recently, a lot of people have come into the fandom who, not knowing the history of BTS and ARMY, buy into the stories of haters, obsessed fanatics and random townsfolk. And why are all these disrespectful people called ARMYs???  REMINDER!!! â„– 1. People who stalk guys are not ARMYs. These are sasaengs and stalkers, obsessed fanatics and paparazzi. Many of them get paid for it, such as fan sites that buy information about guys from sasaengs, etc. SASAENGS/STALKERS THAT VIOLATE PRIVACY! THIS IS NOT ARMY.  â„– 2. People who consider BTS to be their property for their own interests are not ARMYs. â„– 3. The people who hide behind "love one member" and spread hate on the rest of the members are not ARMYs.  â„– 4. People randomly listening to a couple of BTS songs and pretending to know the guys best are also not ARMYs. â„– 5. Multi K-poppers that token stan one member and spread the hate to other non-ARMYs. â„– 6. People who spread rumors about one of the members being sabotaged by the company or fandom are not ARMYs. These are the enemies that wreak havoc. They are dramatists seeking influence and recognition. They are provocateurs and manipulators. These are people with a savior complex who want to boost their ego through guys. â„– 7. Token stans, visual stans are also not ARMYs. They do not know anything about BTS and are ready to spread rumors and speculation about them. They don't care about guys. They are only interested in appearance and fan fights.  There are no real ARMYs among those who approve or support disrespectful behavior. These are solos, mantis, shippers, sasaengs, stalkers, cosplayers, fake armys, random laymen calling themselves a fandom name for influence and likes, toxic K-poppers (they hate BTS because their own favorites are less successful).   ARMYs have always come out against akgaes, toxic token stans from other fandoms, some of which have been revealed as ANTI more than once.  ARMY against crazy shippers, manti narratives, sasaengs, stalkers.  It is they who justify such behavior, persecute the members. Just look at their accounts, they support everything that ARMYs are trying to overcome. All these solo accounts that meddle in the members' lives like they belong to them, and the stupid solo/"armys" who maintain these accounts need to go. All the breaks come from these of people. And also from some deceived ARMYs who do not understand all the nuances and do not even know that they support the wrong behavior of those people about whom I wrote above.  The scary thing is that many of these people often pretend to be ARMY, cosplaying their behavior at first, and under the guise of spreading their disrespectful ideas. Learn the history of BTSARMY, don't buy into the cheap narratives of disrespectful people, don't believe solos/akgaes, shippers, token stans. All these people are concerned only with their fictions, not with the guys.  SOLOS (AKGAES), MANTIS, SHIPPERS, COSPLAYERS, HATERS AND TOXIC K-POPPERS PRETENDING ARMY ARE NOT ARMYs

I keep coming back to this song as time has gone on. First, it was the visuals that were just fascinatinly awesome. Then, the beat seductively pushed forward to become an earworm. Lastly was the lyrics - which got deeper with every listen. It's like hearing a new song every play.  The creative side of the members of this group is unbelievable. I will love J-hope even if I will (although I have been more than once - ha-ha-ha) his only fan. fans who easily change their reference points - it is clear that today one is a favorite, tomorrow another - and what is the value in them? who wants to impress a weather vane?
